column4: You need an ext3 and a swap for ubuntu but your ntfs will be readable and writeable
with the LiveCD how long should it take on an AMD Athlon 64 X2 4000+ to boot or install?
no idea, my guess is around 20 min
not to boot.. the first menu should be up in seconds
At start or install press F6 and remove Quiet and Splash from the command line. If it still fails.. Repeat and after removing quiet and splash add noapic acpi=off before the "--"
found the problem
Glad to hear it
Im just happy you got it sorted out
sudo apt-get install wine
or synaptic if you prefer
for help with that... /join #winehq
yes.. twinview, xinerama  se also !dualhead
xinerama nvidia combo cant do compiz....  use twinview

Fixing sound.. download this: http://hg.alsa-project.org/alsa/raw-file/tip/alsa-info.sh  #and run the script as Normal User... with this command: bash ./alsa-info.sh  ... then go to http://en.pastebin.ca/906336 and answer those questions ..  then  /join #Alsa and provide them with your question and a link to the uploaded file.
is there a way without using the screen resolution prefs to set my resolution differently? I have a Single Card-Two Monitor screen solution.

my audio only works in Pulseaudio even though the card is OSS modeled (according to the Windows version of the drivers). How would i go about disabling the onboard card and installing the Audigy SE I have in my computer as well?
I would /join #Alsa and ask them
thanks
no
THey are slow but good..  LEt me get you started one sec..
thanks

Fixing sound.. download this: http://hg.alsa-project.org/alsa/raw-file/tip/alsa-info.sh  #and run the script as Normal User... with this command: bash ./alsa-info.sh  ... then go to http://en.pastebin.ca/906336 and answer those questions ..  then  /join #Alsa and provide them with your question and a link to the uploaded file.
that is where they would have you start anyhow
